quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actor and Police
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, battery. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This singer was caught by police and charged with performing a lewd act in a public restroom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Michael

questions.question: Who wins in the game of Scrabble?

options.text: The first person to use all their letters
The person with the highest score
No one does, its just for fun.
The person with the least amount of points

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The person with the highest score

questions.question: What role did Billy Bob Thornton play in the western Tombstone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Tyler

questions.question: This football player was accused of murdering his former wife Nicole Brown, and her friend, Ronald Goldman, in 1994.  He was acquitted the following year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: O. J. Simpson

questions.question: This actress was caught stealing in a store in 2002. She was convicted of grand theft and felony vandalism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winona Ryder

questions.question: You may never exchange your letters in the game of Scrabble.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 2001, this actor had cocaine related charges made against him. He was arrested in Palm Springs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Downey Jr

questions.question: This famous singers family home was searched by the police in 1993 for evidence of child molestation.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jackson

questions.question: This rap singer was convicted in March 2005 of lying to a federal grand jury about a shooting outside a radio station in 2001.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lil Kim

questions.question: This actress was sued for slapping a police officer because he pulled her over and gave her a ticket.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zsa Zsa Gabor

questions.question: In the western Tombstone, what was Doc Holliday’s answer to Ringos Isnt anyone here man enough to play for blood?”

options.text: Not me. Im in my prime.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Im your huckleberry.

questions.question: In 1996 this rock musician was convicted of battery for pushing over a photographer who tried to get a picture of him and his wife.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tommy Lee

questions.question: On June 27, 1995 this actor was caught in a car, having sexual intercourse with a prostitute. Police arrested him for lewd behavior.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hugh Grant

questions.question: Which actor starred as Doc Holliday in Tombstone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Val Kilmer

questions.question: On February 8, 1994 a Mercedes Benz cut off this actor in traffic.  Having a serious case of road rage, he got out of his car, smashed the windshield and the roof of the Mercedes with a golf club and drove off.  He was charged with misdemeanor assault, vandalism and battery.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Nicholson

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Tombstone and State
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, leader. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the western Tombstone, who said It would appear that the strain was more than he could bear.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doc

questions.question: In which of these states is Slippery Rock University located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pennsylvania

questions.question: In which of these states can you find Appalachian State University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Carolina

questions.question: What year was Tombstone released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1993

questions.question: Name the state in which Murray State University is located.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kentucky

questions.question: Morehead State University is in the city of Morehead that is located in which state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kentucky

questions.question: Dana Dalany played Wyatts wife Mattie in the film Tombstone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who stars as the county sheriff John Behan in the Tombstone western movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jon Tenney

questions.question: In which of these states is Austin Peay State University located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennessee

questions.question: Tulane University is in which of the following states?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louisiana

questions.question: What state is Gonzaga University in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington

questions.question: The Old Dominion University Monarchs are from which state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia

questions.question: In Tombstone, who was leader of the Cowboys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Curly Bill Brocious

questions.question: In the Western Tombstone Sam Elliot plays the role of Morgan Earp.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In Tombstone, Morgan was Wyatt Earp’s brother that gets killed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Doctor and Green Acres
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, mean, prescription. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: After checking your blood pressure, the doctor says the diastolic pressure is elevated. To which number is he referring?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The bottom number

questions.question: The TV show Green Acres was set in the fictional town of Hooterville.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What does the prefix tachy- mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: too fast

questions.question: St. Bonaventure University, founded in 1858, is located in Cattaraugus County. Which state is it in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: If the doctor writes NSR on your electrocardiogram, what can you expect him to tell you?

options.text: That youll need open heart surgery
That the reading isnt accurate and the test should be repeated
That youll have to take medication for your heart

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: That everything is fine

questions.question: The suffix -itis refers to what condition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: inflammation

questions.question: During a physical exam, the doctor says he wants to auscultate your heart. What instrument will he use?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stethoscope

questions.question: To palpate your thyroid gland, what part of your body will the doctor touch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neck

questions.question: The doctor says you need a CBC. What is he talking about?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A blood test

questions.question: The doctor writes a prescription with instructions to take the medication PRN. What does PRN mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: As needed

questions.question: Where are the Islets of Langerhans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in the pancreas

questions.question: On the show Green Acres, the name of Oliver Wendall Douglass wife was Eva.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In preparation for a blood test, the lab slip says you have to be NPO for 8 hours prior to the test. What do you have to do?

options.text: Lie flat in bed for 8 hours
Do not take anything by mouth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Do not take anything by mouth

questions.question: Which of these states is the location of Marshall University?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Virginia

questions.question: What year did Green Acres first air on television?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1965

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Green Acres and Spanish
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, alvy, acres. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which character on Green Acres was played by Alvy Moore?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Kimball

questions.question: Which if the following translates as We are going to the store in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vamos a la tienda.

questions.question: Where did the phone company install the Douglases phone in the series Green Acres?

options.text: On top of the telephone pole

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On top of the telephone pole

questions.question: Oliver from Green Acres was an attorney in New York before moving to Hooterville.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the last name of Eustace Charleton, the wacky character on Green Acres?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haney

questions.question: What is the Spanish equivalent of apple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manzana

questions.question: How do you say Im lost in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Estoy perdido.

questions.question: On the show Green Acres, what was the name of the pig adopted by Fred and Doris Ziffel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold

questions.question: What is the word for grandmother in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abuela

questions.question: Green Acres ran on television for 9 seasons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How do you say to the right in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A la derecha

questions.question: Which of these sentences translates as The trees are green. in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los arboles son verdes.

questions.question: How do you say I feel hot in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tengo calor.

questions.question: How do you ask What is your name? in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Come se llama usted?

questions.question: How do you say fire-fighter in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bombero

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Clint Eastwood and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, known. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what movie is Eastwoods character on the run from bounty hunters and Union soldiers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Outlaw Josey Wales

questions.question: This actress, best known for her roles in Legally Blonde and Walk the Line, got engaged to Ryan Phillippe in 1998, and co-starred with him in the 1999 hit movie Cruel Intentions.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reese Witherspoon

questions.question: No me gusta is Spanish for I dont like it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which Hollywood actress won an Academy Award for her portrayal of the young transman, Brandon Teena in the 1999 movie Boys Dont Cry?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hilary Swank

questions.question: Which American actor, known for his passion for basketball and the LA Lakers in particular, appeared in One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest as Randle Patrick McMurphy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Nicholson

questions.question: Which Academy Award-winning film actor married Madonna in 1985 and divorced her in 1989?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sean Penn

questions.question: When was Clint Eastwood born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: May 31, 1930

questions.question: In 2004, this Academy Award-winning actress, was listed by the Australian magazine BRW, as the richest Australian woman under 40.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicole Kidman

questions.question: Clint Eastwood was drafted into the US Army in 1951 and stationed at Ft. Ord, CA. What duty did he perform while there?

options.text: None, he broke his arm within the first week and was medically discharged

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: swimming instructor

questions.question: In 2004, this English actress received her fourth Academy Award nomination for her performance in the movie Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kate Winslet

questions.question: Clint Eastwood was born in Carmel, California.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many movies were made featuring the character Dirty Harry during the 70s and 80s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: For which two movies has Clint Eastwood been given the Academy Award for Best Director?

options.text: Mystic River  Midnight in the Garden of Good  Evil

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unforgiven  Million Dollar Baby

questions.question: Eastwood portrayed the man with no name in a trilogy of spaghetti westerns.  Which of these is NOT one of those films.

options.text: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: High Plains Drifter

questions.question: Which of the Baldwin brothers was married to Kim Basinger from 1993 to 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alec

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Detective and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, deaths. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This fictional detective first appeared in the novel, ‘The Murder at the Vicarage’. Her motto is The young people think the old people are fools, but the old people know the young people are fools.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miss Jane Marple

questions.question: This literary private eye, who works in Southern California, was first introduced in the novel, ‘The Moving Target’.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lew Archer

questions.question: This Golden Globe-winning actress was arrested on December 12, 2001 for shoplifting designer clothes in a department store in Beverly Hills.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winona Ryder

questions.question: Which Welsh-born actor got two Oscar nominations for playing US Presidents in the movies Nixon and Amistad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Anthony Hopkins

questions.question: This eccentric literary detective, who lives alone in Paris, is the creation of Edgar Allan Poe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Auguste Dupin

questions.question: Marijuana can cause infertility in both men and women.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This Hollywood actress, who at the age of 7 starred in the film E.T. the Extra -Terrestrial, described her troubled childhood in her 1990 autobiography, Little Girl Lost.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drew Barrymore

questions.question: Marijuana overdose related deaths were reported to have increased among youths in the USA in the last decade of the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This fictional police detective, who likes smoking pipes, is the literary creation of Georges Simenon. Unlike his assistant Leroy, he often relies on his instincts in solving cases.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jules Maigret

questions.question: This fictional character, depicted by G. K. Chesterton, is both a detective and a Catholic priest. He addressed the following words to the reformed criminal, Flambeau: ‘Has it never struck you that a man who does next to nothing but hear mens real sins is not likely to be wholly unaware of human evil?.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Father Brown

questions.question: The name of this fictional detective from the novel, ‘The Roman Hat Mystery’ is also the pseudonym under which the two cousins, Frederick Dannay and Manfred B. Lee wrote detective fiction.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ellery Queen

questions.question: The following words belong to a fictional private detective, created by Agatha Cristie: ‘I, who have undoubtedly the finest brain in Europe at present, can afford to be magnanimous.’
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hercule Poirot

questions.question: This fictional private eye made the following observation in the book, ‘The Big Sleep’: ‘Dead men are heavier than broken hearts‘.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phillip Marlowe

questions.question: This fictional detective, described as a ‘hard and shifty fellow’, is the leading character in the novel ‘The Maltese Falcon’.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sam Spade

questions.question: This fictional detective, created by a British author and physician, delivered the following words in the short story, ‘The Boscome Valley Mystery’: ‘There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.’
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sherlock Holmes
